article_title: Sebelius Gives Drug Makers a Shot in the Arm
article_text:
Drug makers scored a significant win last week in their effort to increase sales from the rollout of the health-care overhaul, when the Obama administration cleared a path for the companies to help pay patients' out-of-pocket costs of prescriptions.

At issue was whether drug makers could help cover the cost of copayments on brand-name drugs for patients who get insurance through the overhaul's new insurance exchanges. The...

twitter.description: The Obama administration ruled that under the Affordable Care Act, drug makers can help pay prescription-drug costs for patients on health-care exchanges. Pharmacy-benefit managers object, saying it steers patients away from generic drugs.
twitter.creator: @Loftus

image.alt: Drug makers spend an estimated $4 billion a year on copayment assistance to patients

twitter.title: Branded Drugs Chalk Up a Win Under Health Law

article_metadata.author: Jonathan D. Rockoff and Peter Loftus
article_metadata.article.origheadline: Branded Drugs Chalk Up a Win Under Health Law

article_summary:
At issue was whether drug makers could help cover the cost of copayments on brand-name drugs for patients who get insurance through the overhaul's new insurance exchanges.
Drug makers scored a significant win last week in their effort to increase sales from the rollout of the health-care overhaul, when the Obama administration cleared a path for the companies to help pay patients' out-of-pocket costs of prescriptions.
